title: Cap Recalculation Job
description:
Implement Scheduled Daily Capacity Calculation and Alert System

Create an automated job that runs daily to calculate capacity metrics and send alerts when limits are approaching or exceeded.

Requirements:
- Schedule a recurring job to run at a specific time each day (determine optimal time, e.g., end of business day or midnight)
- Calculate daily capacity metrics based on current data (define specific metrics: resource utilization, quota usage, throughput, etc.)
- Compare calculated values against predefined thresholds/limits
- Trigger alerts when capacity approaches warning threshold (e.g., 80%) or exceeds critical threshold (e.g., 95%)
- Send notifications through appropriate channels (email, SMS, dashboard, Slack, etc.)
- Log all calculations and alert events for audit trail
- Handle job failures gracefully with retry logic and error notifications
- Ensure idempotency to prevent duplicate alerts if job runs multiple times
- Make thresholds and alert recipients configurable
- Include relevant context in alerts (current usage, limit, trend data, recommended actions)

Edge cases to consider:
- What happens if the job fails to run on a given day?
- How to handle missing or incomplete data during calculations?
- Should alerts be suppressed on weekends/holidays?
- How to prevent alert fatigue from repeated notifications?

Dependencies:
- Access to capacity/usage data sources
- Job scheduling infrastructure (cron, task queue, scheduler service)
- Notification service integration
- Configuration management for thresholds and recipients
